item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Naomi Novik
item.description: "It is quite uninteresting; that is why one comes out." <i>â€” Temeraire, on being inside an egg</i>" -- Naomi Novik

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Naomi Novik
item.description: "I should rather have you than a heap of gold, even if it were very comfortable to sleep on." -- Naomi Novik

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Jonathan Stroud
item.description: "According to some, heroic deaths are admirable things. I've never been convinced by this argument, mainly because, no matter how cool, stylish, composed, unflappable, manly, or defiant you are, at the end of the day you're also dead. Which is a little too permanent for my liking." -- Jonathan Stroud

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "It's as if scientists exert every effort of will they possess deliberately to find the least significant problems in the world and explain them. Art matters. Happiness matters. Love matters. Good matters. Evil matters. Slam the fridge door. They are the only things that matter and they are of course precisely the things that science goes out of its way to ignore." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Poppy Z. Brite
item.description: "He has '<i>le coeur comme un artichaud</i>'. Eddy fumbled for her high school French. 'A heart like an artichoke?' '<i>Oui</i>. He has a leaf for everyone, but makes a meal for no one." -- Poppy Z. Brite

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Heinlein
item.description: "I've never been able to understand 'faith' myself, nor to see how a just God could expect his creatures to pick the one true religion out of an infinitude of false ones - by faith alone. It strikes me as a sloppy way to run an organization, whether universe or a smaller one." -- Heinlein

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Well, while you were in the bathroom, I sat down at this picnic table here in Bumblefug, Kentucky, and noticed that someone had carved that GOD HATES FAG, which, aside from being a grammatical nightmare, is absolutely ridiculous. So I'm changing it to 'God Hates Baguettes.' It's tough to disagree with that. Everybody hates baguettes." -- John Green

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "It kills me sometimes, how people die." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Suuanda add a quote by Isaac Marion
item.description: "Why is it beautiful that humanity keeps coming back? So does herpes." -- Isaac Marion
